item.title: The SEC Updates the US Dollar Stablecoin Accounting Rules Staff Guide, With Some Stablecoins Being Considered as Cash
item.description: On August 5th, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) updated its staff guidance on stablecoin accounting rules. The key point of the new guidance is that if a stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar has a collateralized redemption mechanism and its value stability is pegged to another asset type, it may be classified as "cash equivalent".While the SEC is formulating broader cryptocurrency regulatory rules, this latest interim guidance is part of Chairman Paul Atkins' efforts to remove restrictive measures. For instance, in April of this year, the SEC clearly stated that a "covered" U.S. dollar stablecoin is not regarded as a security and confirmed that entities engaged in stablecoin issuance and redemption activities do not need to register with the agency for such activities.

item.title: Analyst: The Federal Reserve should adjust its dual mandate target and readjust its monetary policy
item.description: On August 5th, Brij Khurana, the Fixed Income Portfolio Manager of Wellington Management, stated that the Federal Reserve plans to update its statement every 5 years, detailing how it will fulfill its dual mandate of maximizing employment and maintaining price stability. The Federal Reserve last issued this statement during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic and adopted a framework focusing on a 2% long-term average inflation rate.Later this year, when the Federal Reserve releases its next statement, it should carefully reconsider its dual mandate and adjust its monetary policy to move towards maximizing productivity. Since 2008, the annual growth rate of US productivity has slowed down to 1.6%, which is lower than the 2.4% over the previous 18 years. item.title: Binance will conduct wallet maintenance for USDC withdrawals on the Ethereum mainnet, Polygon, and other networks
item.description: August 5th. According to official channels, Binance will carry out wallet maintenance for USD Coin (USDC) on Ethereum (ETH), Polygon (POL), Arbitrum (ARB), Base (BASE), and Optimism (OP) at 15:00 (UTC+8) on August 6th, 2025.To facilitate this maintenance, Binance will halt USD Coin (USDC) withdrawals on Ethereum (ETH), Polygon (POL), Arbitrum (ARB), Base (BASE), and Optimism (OP) starting from 15:00 (UTC+8) on August 6th, 2025. The maintenance is projected to last for 2 hours, and withdrawals will resume automatically upon the completion of the maintenance.

item.title: 「Quad-Shorter with 75% ETH Win Rate」 Adds to ETH Short Position, Current Position Size Reaches $127 Million
item.description: On August 5th, according to the monitoring of HyperInsight accessible via https://app.hyperliquid.xyz/join/NTOD, the "Four Battles ETH 75% Win Rate Whale" augmented its short position in ETH to 35,000 coins (with a nominal value of approximately $127 million). item.title: Payment service company Remitly will adopt a stablecoin for cross-border payments
item.description: On August 5th, the payment service company Remitly is going to adopt stablecoin technology in order to enhance its international remittance capabilities. This action is intended to position Remitly at the forefront of financial technology innovation. By using blockchain technology, it will be able to provide customers in more than 170 countries with faster, more cost-effective, and secure cross-border payment solutions.

item.title: Thomas Lee: ETH Will Still Be One of the Biggest Macro Trends in the Next 10 to 15 Years
item.description: On August 5th, Thomas Lee, the chairman of the board of BitMine, tweeted, saying, "BMNR currently possesses 833,133 ETH, which is worth 3 billion US dollars. This makes it the largest ETH treasury in the world and the third-largest cryptocurrency treasury in the world."As Wall Street financializes blockchain and artificial intelligence leads to the tokenization of robotic assets, ETH will continue to be one of the biggest macro trends in the next 10 to 15 years.

item.title: Bloomberg Analyst: Bitcoin's Volatility Has Significantly Decreased Since the Launch of a Bitcoin Spot ETF, Now Less Than Twice That of Gold
item.description: On August 5th, Bloomberg ETF Senior Analyst Eric Balchunas posted on social media, saying, "Since the listing of the Bitcoin ETF, its volatility has decreased significantly. The 90-day rolling volatility has dropped below 40 for the first time, while it was above 60 at the time of the ETF listing. For comparison, when combined with GLD data, Bitcoin's volatility is now less than twice that of gold, whereas it used to be more than three times."
